title: 2009 Malaysia Super League
text:
The 2009 Liga Super () also known as the TM Liga Super for sponsorship reasons is the sixth season of the <a href="Liga%20Super">Liga Super</a>, the top-tier professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> league in Malaysia.
The season was held from 3 January and concluded on 3 August 2009.
The <a href="Liga%20Super">Liga Super</a> champions for 2009 was <a href="Selangor%20FA">Selangor</a>.
Teams.
A total of 14 teams compete in the 2009 season which includes the top 12 teams that participated in the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Liga%20Premier">2007–08 season</a> and champions and runners-up of the <a href="2007-08%20Liga%20Premier">2007-08 Liga Premier</a>.
<a href="Sarawak%20FA">Sarawak</a> were relegated at the end of the 2009 Liga Super season after finishing in the bottom place of the league table.
<a href="DPMM%20FC">DPMM</a> was excluded from the competition as per FIFA rules after <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Brunei%20Darussalam">Football Association of Brunei Darussalam</a> was deregistered by the Registrar of Societies.
<a href="2007-08%20Liga%20Premier">2007-08 Liga Premier</a> champions <a href="Kuala%20Muda%20Naza%20F.C.">Kuala Muda Naza</a> and runners-up <a href="PLUS%20F.C.">PLUS</a> secured direct promotion to the Liga Super.
